intro: Pristiglottis pubescens, commonly known as the hairy livershook, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its tufted, hairy leaves and small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is often found in coastal regions. Pristiglottis pubescens is a perennial plant that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
